thread.title: ‘Let me make this clear…’ Grieving Fadi lets fly on George funeral claims in all-caps rant
thread.title_full: ‘Let me make this clear…’ Grieving Fadi lets fly on George funeral claims in all-caps rant

title: ‘Let me make this clear…’ Grieving Fadi lets fly on George funeral claims in all-caps rant
text:
GETTY RAGE: Fadi let fly on haters who believed he was banned from George's funeral 
The celebrity hairdresser, 43, tweeted an intimate black and white picture of the star planting a tender kiss on his forehead with the caption: “This image says it all.” 
He then ranted: “Let me make it clear that I’M NOT BANNED TO GO TO THE FUNERAL none of it is true, ITS NOT TRUE, NOT TRUE NOT TRUE NOT TRUE.” 
TWITTER TOGETHER: Fadi and George in a tender embrace “Let me make it clear that I’M NOT BANNED TO GO TO THE FUNERAL none of it is true, ITS NOT TRUE, NOT TRUE NOT TRUE NOT TRUE” Fadi Fawaz 
The outburst will put increasing strain on an already heated relationship between the later singer’s lover and his family. 
The Wham! star’s cousin, Andros Georgiou, previously claimed fine art photographer Fadi would not be allowed to attend the private service because the “family hate him”. 
He said: “Fadi has not been invited to the funeral. He is not welcome, the family hate him. Heaven help him if he turned up. 
TWITTER FURY: Fadi took to twitter in an all-cap rant 
“Fadi was not really his boyfriend. No one has spoken to him and he just seems to be getting on with his life. It makes my stomach turn.” 
They were apparently incensed after Fadi claimed that George killed himself in a bizarre series of Twitter posts following his death on Christmas Day. 
Police are treating his death as “unexplained” which has led to increasing speculation the singer, who had a well-documented battle with hard drugs, could have died as a result of a relapse. George Michael in pictures Pop icon George Michael in pictures 1 / 16 Getty Images George Michael Performs At Palais Garnier in 2012 
The speculation has only increased since it emerged that George’s family may have to wait until March to bury him. 
This is because of delays in toxicology tests, which may give to vital clues about how the singer, 53, died at his Oxfordshire mansion. 
It also emerged that the star’s £105million estate is due to be frozen, meaning Fadi will be evicted from George’s £2.5m London home. Related articles
